newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks close up on technical correction.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks close up on technical correction.

text.p: Pakistani stocks closed up on Sunday on technical correction when the market reopened after the Friday-Saturday weekend, dealers said.
They said the share index was likely to open mixed on Monday's clearing day and close higher owing to short-covering.
Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) 100-share index closed 9.34 points, or 0.69 percent, up at 1,363.01 after falling to 1,348.98 in early trade. Losers led gainers 109 to 78.
Volume fell to 8.8 million shares owing to an opposition-called general strike in Karachi and thin attendance in the trading hall compared to Thursday's 29.7 million.
"A long-awaited technical correction took place that resulted in a little bullish rally before the close," one dealer said. The index rise was due to short covering before Monday's clearing day.
PSO rose 5.00 rupees to 322, Adamjee Insurance 4.00 to 89, Telecard 8.00 to 48, HUBCO 0.40 to 29.50 and ICI 0.65 to 14.10.
